title: Why is hydrogen ion positive? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is not necessarily positive. Hydrogen ion can be positive an electron is removed from hydrogen and then it is H+. H+ is usually an acid and protonates anything that it can, like water. However, you can also add an electron and become hydride, H-, which is negatively charged. Hydride is a good reducing agent and reduces things like ketones, acids…and common sources are sodium borohydride, lithium aluminum hydride, and many others.
